sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations with complex coefficients
message_1:
Solve the following system of linear equations with complex coefficients:

2x + 3y + 4z = 5 + 6i

5x - 7y + 3z = -2 - 3i

x + 2y + z = 3 + 2i

where i is the imaginary unit.
message_2:
To solve this system of linear equations, we can use the method of substitution or elimination. In this case, we will use the elimination method. First, we will eliminate x from the second and third equations.

Multiply the first equation by 5 and the third equation by -2 to make the coefficients of x in both equations equal:

(1) 10x + 15y + 20z = 25 + 30i
(2) -2x - 4y - 2z = -6 - 4i

Now, add equations (1) and (2) to eliminate x:

13y + 18z = 19 + 26i

Now, we have a new system of equations:

2x + 3y + 4z = 5 + 6i
5x - 7y + 3z = -2 - 3i
13y + 18z = 19 + 26i

Next, we will eliminate x from the first and second equations. Multiply the first equation by 5 and the second equation by 2 to make the coefficients of x equal:

(1) 10x + 15y + 20z = 25 + 30i
(2) 10x - 14y + 6z = -4 - 6i

Now, subtract equation (2) from equation (1) to eliminate x:

29y + 14z = 29 + 36i

Now, we have a new system of equations:

2x + 3y + 4z = 5 + 6i
13y + 18z = 19 + 26i
29y + 14z = 29 + 36i

Now, we will eliminate y from the second and third equations. Multiply the second equation by 29 and the third equation by 13 to make the coefficients of y equal:

(1) 377y + 522z = 551 + 754i
(2) 377y + 182z = 377 + 468i

Now, subtract equation (2) from equation (1) to eliminate y:

340z = 174 + 286i

Now, divide both sides by 340:

z = (174 + 286i) / 340
z = 1/2 + (13/15)i

Now that we have z, we can substitute it back into the second equation to find y:

13y + 18(1/2 + (13/15)i) = 19 + 26i
13y + 9 + 18(13/15)i = 19 + 26i

Subtract 9 from both sides:

13y + 18(13/15)i = 10 + 26i

Now, divide both sides by 13:

y + (18/15)i = (10/13) + (2/13)i

Subtract (18/15)i from both sides:

y = (10/13) - (4/13)i

Now that we have y, we can substitute y and z back into the first equation to find x:

2x + 3((10/13) - (4/13)i) + 4(1/2 + (13/15)i) = 5 + 6i

Simplify the equation:

2x + (30/13) - (12/13)i + 2 + (52/15)i = 5 + 6i

Subtract (30/13) and 2 from both sides:

2x = (5/13) + (50/15)i

Now, divide both sides by 2:

x = (5/26) + (25/30)i
x = (5/26) + (5/6)i

Now we have the values of x, y, and z:

x = (5/26) + (5/6)i
y = (10/13) - (4/13)i
z = 1/2 + (13/15)i
